result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: from the Court regarding how to obtain an appointed attorney
Status conference on December 19, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not threaten or direct any acts of physical violence towards Mitchell S. 
- Defendant shall not consume or possess alcohol. 
Trial Judge - Br 17

9:06 AM Defendant Stanley K St John in court.  Prosecuting attorney Tomas Fernando Valerio in court for the State of Wisconsin. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Pre-trial conference on December 19, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
S&C served to Jean St John (wife) 10/5/22
Initial appearance on October 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

10:27 AM Defendant Stanley K St John not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Tomas Fernando Valerio in court for the State of Wisconsin. State unable to provide evidence of sufficient personal service of notice for hearing. Court rescheduled Initial Appearance, State to issue Summons (or other attempt at service).
